passage_text: TURLEY. The name Turley in Ireland is derived from the native Gaelic Mac Toirdealbhaigh Sept that was located in Counties Armagh and Down in the North of the country. The name is taken from the Gaelic first name 'Turlough'. This Sept name was also anglicized as Torley, Terence and Terry.
